[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Cryptographic validation] [Network authentication keys] Does validator network config validation include checking for valid cryptographic keys, or can validators be configured with compromised/weak keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Cryptographic validation] [Key rotation] If validator keys are rotated, does sanitization ensure new keys are validated, or can stale/revoked keys persist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Cryptographic validation] [TLS configuration] Beyond mutual_authentication boolean, are TLS protocol versions, cipher suites, and certificate validation also checked during sanitization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Timing attack] [Validation timing] Does validation timing leak information about config contents that attackers can use to deduce internal validation logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Timing attack] [TOCTOU window] What is the time window between sanitization and config usage? Can attackers modify config during this window? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [State machine] [Node type transitions] Can a node change type (validator -> fullnode or vice versa) after sanitization? If so, is re-sanitization enforced? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [State machine] [Chain ID migration] If a node migrates between chains (testnet -> mainnet), is config re-sanitized with new chain_id, or can old testnet configs persist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [State machine] [Live config updates] Can config be updated while the node is running? If so, is sanitization re-run, or can hot-swapped configs bypass validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [DoS vector] [Validation complexity] Can attackers craft configs with maximum complexity (many networks, long strings) to cause validation to take excessive time, delaying node startup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [DoS vector] [Error message generation] Do error messages at lines 87, 98, 103, 124, 137, 144, etc. allocate excessive memory for large config values causing OOM? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [DoS vector] [HashSet memory] Can attackers configure thousands of unique network_ids to exhaust memory in the HashSet at line 129? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Governance bypass] [Skip sanitizer governance] Should skip_config_sanitizer be controllable via on-chain governance, or can individual node operators bypass security policies unilaterally? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Governance bypass] [Network policy enforcement] Can on-chain governance enforce specific network configurations, or can validators deviate from governance-mandated network topology? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Default values] [NodeConfig defaults] What are the default values for NodeConfig fields? Can default configs pass sanitization but still be insecure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Default values] [Mutual authentication default] Is mutual_authentication true by default, or can configs be created with it disabled by default? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Initialization order] [Sanitization timing] Is sanitization called before or after config deserialization? Can deserialization vulnerabilities bypass sanitization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Serialization] [Config persistence] After sanitization passes, is the validated config persisted? Can persisted configs be tampered with before node restart? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Serialization] [Format validation] Does sanitization validate config file format (TOML/YAML/JSON), or can malformed formats bypass validation during parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Logging] [Sensitive data in errors] Do error messages leak sensitive configuration details (network addresses, keys) that could help attackers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Logging] [Validation success/failure] Is successful sanitization logged? Can attackers detect when their malicious configs are being rejected? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Critical scenario] [Zero-day config exploit] If a zero-day vulnerability exists in a sub-config sanitizer, can attackers bypass the entire sanitization chain by exploiting that single sanitizer? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Critical scenario] [Supply chain attack] Can an attacker modify the NodeConfig struct definition itself to add malicious fields that are never sanitized? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Critical scenario] [Upgrade path vulnerability] During protocol upgrades, can old configs bypass new sanitization rules, allowing legacy vulnerable configurations to persist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Critical scenario] [Multi-validator coordination] Can multiple colluding validators coordinate their configs to pass individual sanitization but create network-wide vulnerabilities when combined? (Critical)
